topic_name: Pair of Linear Equations in Two Variables

canonical_explanation.text: A pair of linear equations in two variables x and y is of the form a1x + b1y + c1 = 0 and a2x + b2y + c2 = 0. The system can be consistent (unique or infinite solutions) or inconsistent (no solution). These can be solved graphically, by substitution, elimination, or cross-multiplication methods.
rules: Infinite solutions (coincident lines): a1/a2 = b1/b2 = c1/c2
No solution (parallel lines): a1/a2 = b1/b2 != c1/c2
Substitution: Express one variable from one equation and substitute in the other
Elimination: Make coefficients of one variable equal and add/subtract

questions.question_text: The pair of equations x + 2y = 5 and 3x + 6y = 15 has:
questions.explanation_correct: a1/a2 = 1/3, b1/b2 = 2/6 = 1/3, c1/c2 = 5/15 = 1/3. Since a1/a2 = b1/b2 = c1/c2, the lines are coincident and there are infinitely many solutions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Compare ratios: 1/3 = 2/6 = 5/15 (all equal to 1/3). When all three ratios are equal, the equations represent the same line.

questions.question_text: The pair of equations x + y = 5 and 2x + 2y = 8 has:
questions.explanation_correct: a1/a2 = 1/2, b1/b2 = 1/2, c1/c2 = 5/8. Since a1/a2 = b1/b2 but not equal to c1/c2, the lines are parallel. No solution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 1/2 = 1/2 but 5/8 is different. When a1/a2 = b1/b2 != c1/c2, the lines are parallel and there is no solution.

questions.question_text: The pair of equations 2x + 3y = 7 and 3x - y = 5 has:
questions.explanation_correct: a1/a2 = 2/3, b1/b2 = 3/(-1) = -3. Since 2/3 != -3, the system has a unique solution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Since a1/a2 != b1/b2, the lines intersect at exactly one point, giving a unique solution.

questions.question_text: If two lines are parallel, the pair of linear equations has no solution.
questions.explanation_correct: Parallel lines never intersect, so there is no common solution. The system is inconsistent.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parallel lines have no point of intersection, meaning no ordered pair (x, y) satisfies both equations simultaneously.

questions.question_text: For what value of k will the pair of equations kx + 3y = k - 3 and 12x + ky = k have no solution?
questions.explanation_correct: No solution requires a1/a2 = b1/b2 != c1/c2. Rewrite: kx + 3y - (k-3) = 0, 12x + ky - k = 0. k/12 = 3/k gives k^2 = 36, so k = 6 or -6. For k = 6: (k-3)/k = 3/6 = 1/2 = k/12, so all ratios equal (infinite solutions). For k = -6: k/12 = -1/2, 3/k = -1/2, (k-3)/k = 9/6 = 3/2. Since -1/2 != 3/2, k = -6 gives no solution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For no solution: k/12 = 3/k != (k-3)/k. From k/12 = 3/k: k^2 = 36, k = +/-6. For k = 6: all ratios equal (infinite solutions). For k = -6: a1/a2 = b1/b2 != c1/c2 (no solution). So k = -6.

questions.question_text: Solve by substitution: x + y = 14, x - y = 4.
questions.explanation_correct: From x - y = 4: x = y + 4. Substituting in x + y = 14: y + 4 + y = 14, 2y = 10, y = 5. Then x = 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Express x from the second equation: x = y + 4. Substitute into the first: (y + 4) + y = 14, giving y = 5, x = 9.

questions.question_text: Solve by substitution: 2x + y = 7, 4x - 3y = 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Express y = 7 - 2x from the first equation. Substitute into the second: 4x - 3(7-2x) = 1, giving x = 2.2, y = 2.6.

questions.question_text: Solve by substitution: s - t = 3, s/3 + t/2 = 6. The solution is s = ___, t = ___.
questions.explanation_correct: From s - t = 3: s = t + 3. Substituting: (t + 3)/3 + t/2 = 6. Multiply by 6: 2(t + 3) + 3t = 36, 2t + 6 + 3t = 36, 5t = 30, t = 6. s = 9.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Express s = t + 3. Substitute: (t+3)/3 + t/2 = 6. Clearing fractions: 2t + 6 + 3t = 36, t = 6, s = 9.

questions.question_text: Solve by elimination: x + y = 5, 2x - 3y = 4.
questions.explanation_correct: Multiply first equation by 3: 3x + 3y = 15. Add to second: 3x + 3y + 2x - 3y = 15 + 4, 5x = 19, x = 19/5. y = 5 - 19/5 = 6/5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Multiply equation 1 by 3 to eliminate y: 3x + 3y = 15. Adding 2x - 3y = 4: 5x = 19, x = 19/5, y = 6/5.

questions.question_text: Solve by elimination: 3x + 4y = 10, 2x - 2y = 2.
questions.explanation_correct: Multiply second equation by 2: 4x - 4y = 4. Add to first: 7x = 14, x = 2. From 2(2) - 2y = 2: y = 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Multiply equation 2 by 2 to make y-coefficients equal in magnitude: 4x - 4y = 4. Adding to 3x + 4y = 10: 7x = 14, x = 2, y = 1.

questions.question_text: Solve by elimination: 3x + y = 9, 5x - y = 7.
questions.explanation_correct: Add both equations: 8x = 16, x = 2. Substitute: 3(2) + y = 9, y = 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Adding the equations eliminates y: 8x = 16, x = 2. Then y = 9 - 6 = 3.

questions.explanation_correct: Subtract second from first: 7y = 35, y = 5. From 2x + 15 = 11: 2x = -4, x = -2.

questions.question_text: Using cross-multiplication, solve: 2x + 3y = 46, 3x + 5y = 74.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cross-multiplication: x/(b1c2-b2c1) = y/(c1a2-c2a1) = 1/(a1b2-a2b1). Computing: x = 8, y = 10.

questions.question_text: Using cross-multiplication method, solve: x + 2y + 1 = 0, 2x - 3y - 12 = 0.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Applying cross-multiplication formula: x/(-21) = y/14 = 1/(-7). So x = (-21)/(-7) = 3, y = 14/(-7) = -2.

questions.question_text: The sum of two numbers is 35 and their difference is 13. Find the numbers.
questions.explanation_correct: Let numbers be x and y. x + y = 35, x - y = 13. Adding: 2x = 48, x = 24. y = 11.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Set up equations: x + y = 35, x - y = 13. Adding gives 2x = 48, so x = 24 and y = 11.

questions.question_text: 5 pencils and 7 pens together cost Rs 50, while 7 pencils and 5 pens together cost Rs 46. Find the cost of one pencil and one pen.
questions.explanation_correct: Let pencil = x, pen = y. 5x + 7y = 50, 7x + 5y = 46. Adding: 12x + 12y = 96, x + y = 8. Subtracting: -2x + 2y = 4, y - x = 2. From x + y = 8 and y - x = 2: y = 5, x = 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 5x + 7y = 50 and 7x + 5y = 46. Add and subtract to get x = 3 (pencil) and y = 5 (pen).

questions.question_text: A fraction becomes 1/3 when 1 is subtracted from the numerator and it becomes 1/4 when 8 is added to its denominator. Find the fraction.
questions.explanation_correct: Let fraction = x/y. (x-1)/y = 1/3 gives 3x - 3 = y, so y = 3x - 3. x/(y+8) = 1/4 gives 4x = y + 8. Substituting: 4x = 3x - 3 + 8, x = 5, y = 12. Fraction = 5/12.

questions.question_text: A boat goes 30 km upstream and 44 km downstream in 10 hours. In 13 hours, it can go 40 km upstream and 55 km downstream. Find the speed of the boat in still water and the speed of the stream.
questions.explanation_correct: Let boat speed = x, stream = y. Upstream speed = x - y, downstream = x + y. Let 1/(x-y) = u, 1/(x+y) = v. 30u + 44v = 10, 40u + 55v = 13. Solving: u = 1/5, v = 1/11. x - y = 5, x + y = 11. x = 8, y = 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Set u = 1/(x-y), v = 1/(x+y). Equations become 30u + 44v = 10, 40u + 55v = 13. Solving gives x = 8 km/h, y = 3 km/h.

questions.question_text: For what value of k does the pair kx - y = 2 and 6x - 2y = 3 have a unique solution?
questions.explanation_correct: For unique solution: a1/a2 != b1/b2. k/6 != (-1)/(-2), k/6 != 1/2, k != 3. So any value of k other than 3 gives a unique solution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Unique solution requires k/6 != 1/2, so k != 3. All values except k = 3 work.

questions.question_text: For what values of a and b does the pair 2x + 3y = 7, (a-b)x + (a+b)y = 3a + b - 2 have infinitely many solutions?
questions.explanation_correct: For infinitely many solutions: 2/(a-b) = 3/(a+b) = 7/(3a+b-2). From 2/(a-b) = 3/(a+b): 2(a+b) = 3(a-b), 2a+2b = 3a-3b, a = 5b. From 3/(a+b) = 7/(3a+b-2): 3(3a+b-2) = 7(a+b), 9a+3b-6 = 7a+7b, 2a = 4b+6, a = 2b+3. From a = 5b and a = 2b+3: 5b = 2b+3, b = 1, a = 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Set all three ratios equal and solve simultaneously: a = 5b and a = 2b + 3, giving b = 1, a = 5.

questions.question_text: Solve by substitution: x = 3y, 3x - 2y = 7.
questions.explanation_correct: Substitute x = 3y into 3x - 2y = 7: 9y - 2y = 7, 7y = 7, y = 1. x = 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: x = 3y substituted into 3x - 2y = 7 gives 7y = 7, y = 1, x = 3.

questions.question_text: Solve by substitution: 3x - y = 3, 9x - 3y = 9. The system has ___ solutions.
questions.explanation_correct: 9x - 3y = 9 simplifies to 3x - y = 3, which is the same as the first equation. The equations are dependent, giving infinitely many solutions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The second equation is 3 times the first. Both represent the same line, giving infinitely many solutions.

questions.question_text: Solve by elimination: 2x + y = 5, 3x + 2y = 8.
questions.explanation_correct: Multiply first by 2: 4x + 2y = 10. Subtract second: 4x + 2y - 3x - 2y = 10 - 8, x = 2. y = 5 - 4 = 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Multiply first equation by 2 and subtract the second to eliminate y: x = 2, then y = 1.

questions.question_text: Solve: 2/x + 3/y = 13, 5/x - 4/y = -2. (x, y not equal to 0)
questions.explanation_correct: Let u = 1/x, v = 1/y. Then 2u + 3v = 13, 5u - 4v = -2. Multiply first by 4, second by 3: 8u + 12v = 52, 15u - 12v = -6. Add: 23u = 46, u = 2. v = 3. So x = 1/2, y = 1/3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Substitute u = 1/x, v = 1/y to get linear equations. Solve: u = 2, v = 3, so x = 1/2, y = 1/3.

questions.question_text: Meena went to a bank to withdraw Rs 2000. She asked the cashier to give her Rs 50 and Rs 100 notes only. She got 25 notes in all. How many notes of each denomination did she receive?

options.text: 10 notes of Rs 50 and 15 notes of Rs 100
15 notes of Rs 50 and 10 notes of Rs 100
20 notes of Rs 50 and 5 notes of Rs 100
5 notes of Rs 50 and 20 notes of Rs 100

questions.explanation_correct: Let x = number of Rs 50 notes, y = number of Rs 100 notes. x + y = 25, 50x + 100y = 2000. From first: x = 25 - y. Substituting: 50(25 - y) + 100y = 2000, 1250 + 50y = 2000, y = 15. x = 10.
questions.explanation_incorrect: x + y = 25 and 50x + 100y = 2000. Solving gives x = 10 (Rs 50 notes) and y = 15 (Rs 100 notes).

questions.question_text: The sum of the digits of a two-digit number is 9. Also, nine times this number is twice the number obtained by reversing the digits. Find the number.
questions.explanation_correct: Let tens digit = x, units = y. x + y = 9. Number = 10x + y. 9(10x + y) = 2(10y + x). 90x + 9y = 20y + 2x. 88x = 11y, 8x = y. From x + y = 9: x + 8x = 9, x = 1, y = 8. Number = 18.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Set up: x + y = 9 and 9(10x + y) = 2(10y + x). Solving: x = 1, y = 8. The number is 18.

questions.question_text: Ritu can row downstream 20 km in 2 hours, and upstream 4 km in 2 hours. Find her speed in still water and the speed of the current.
questions.explanation_correct: Downstream speed = 20/2 = 10 km/h, upstream speed = 4/2 = 2 km/h. Let boat = x, current = y. x + y = 10, x - y = 2. x = 6, y = 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: x + y = 10 (downstream) and x - y = 2 (upstream). Adding: 2x = 12, x = 6 km/h. y = 4 km/h.

questions.question_text: Two lines represented by equations 3x + 2y = 8 and 6x + 4y = 18 are:
questions.explanation_correct: a1/a2 = 3/6 = 1/2, b1/b2 = 2/4 = 1/2, c1/c2 = 8/18 = 4/9. Since 1/2 = 1/2 but not equal to 4/9, the lines are parallel.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 3/6 = 2/4 = 1/2, but 8/18 = 4/9 is different. So a1/a2 = b1/b2 != c1/c2, meaning parallel lines.

questions.question_text: The pair of equations y = 0 and y = -7 has a solution.
questions.explanation_correct: y cannot be 0 and -7 simultaneously. These are parallel horizontal lines, so there is no solution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: y = 0 and y = -7 are parallel lines (both horizontal), so they never intersect and have no solution.

questions.question_text: The age of the father is twice the sum of the ages of his two children. After 20 years, his age will be equal to the sum of the ages of his children. Find the present age of the father.
questions.explanation_correct: Let father's age = f, sum of children's ages = s. f = 2s. After 20 years: f + 20 = s + 40 (each child ages 20, so total adds 40). 2s + 20 = s + 40, s = 20. f = 40.
questions.explanation_incorrect: f = 2s now. After 20 years: f + 20 = (s + 40). Substituting: 2s + 20 = s + 40, s = 20, f = 40.
Clear fractions: 2x + y = 8 and x + 6y = 15. Solving gives x = 3, y = 2.

questions.question_text: The pair of equations x = a and y = b graphically represents lines which are:
questions.explanation_correct: x = a is a vertical line and y = b is a horizontal line. They always intersect at the point (a, b).
questions.explanation_incorrect: A vertical line x = a and a horizontal line y = b are always perpendicular and meet at exactly one point: (a, b).

questions.question_text: Solve: x - y = 2, x + y = 4.
questions.explanation_correct: Add: 2x = 6, x = 3. Subtract: 2y = 2, y = 1.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Adding the equations: 2x = 6, x = 3. Subtracting: 2y = 2, y = 1.

questions.question_text: Two numbers are in the ratio 5:6. If 8 is subtracted from each, the ratio becomes 4:5. The numbers are ___ and ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Let numbers be 5x and 6x. (5x-8)/(6x-8) = 4/5. 25x - 40 = 24x - 32. x = 8. Numbers = 40, 48.
questions.explanation_incorrect: 5x and 6x are the numbers. (5x-8)/(6x-8) = 4/5 gives x = 8. Numbers: 40 and 48.

questions.question_text: If the pair of equations 2x + 3y = 5 and 4x + ky = 10 has infinitely many solutions, then k = ?
questions.explanation_correct: For infinitely many solutions: a1/a2 = b1/b2 = c1/c2. 2/4 = 3/k = 5/10. 1/2 = 3/k, k = 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: All three ratios must be equal: 2/4 = 3/k = 5/10 = 1/2. So k = 6.

questions.explanation_correct: Add: 200x + 200y = 1000, x + y = 5. Subtract first from second: 2x - 2y = 2, x - y = 1. From x + y = 5 and x - y = 1: x = 3, y = 2.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Adding gives x + y = 5. Subtracting gives x - y = 1. So x = 3, y = 2.

questions.question_text: A train covered a certain distance at a uniform speed. If the speed had been 10 km/h more, it would have taken 2 hours less. If the speed had been 10 km/h less, it would have taken 3 hours more. Find the distance covered.
questions.explanation_correct: Let speed = s, time = t. Distance d = st. (s+10)(t-2) = st gives st - 2s + 10t - 20 = st, so 10t - 2s = 20. (s-10)(t+3) = st gives st + 3s - 10t - 30 = st, so 3s - 10t = 30. Adding: s = 50. t = (20 + 100)/10 = 12. d = 600 km.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Set up: 10t - 2s = 20 and 3s - 10t = 30. Adding: s = 50. Then t = 12. Distance = 50 x 12 = 600 km.

questions.question_text: Solve by substitution: 7x - 15y = 2, x + 2y = 3.
Solve using cross-multiplication: x + 3y = 5, 2x + y = 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cross-multiplication: x/(-10) = y/(-5) = 1/(-5). So x = 2, y = 1.

questions.question_text: Places A and B are 100 km apart on a highway. One car starts from A and another from B at the same time. If they travel in the same direction, they meet in 5 hours; if they travel towards each other, they meet in 1 hour. What are the speeds of the two cars?
questions.explanation_correct: Let speeds be x and y (x > y). Same direction: (x - y) x 5 = 100, x - y = 20. Opposite: (x + y) x 1 = 100, x + y = 100. x = 60, y = 40.
questions.explanation_incorrect: x - y = 20 (same direction) and x + y = 100 (opposite). Solving: x = 60 km/h, y = 40 km/h.

questions.question_text: If a1/a2 != b1/b2 for a pair of linear equations, the system has ___ solution(s).
questions.explanation_correct: When a1/a2 != b1/b2, the two lines intersect at exactly one point, giving a unique solution.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Unequal ratios a1/a2 and b1/b2 mean the lines are not parallel and not coincident, so they intersect at one point.
Adding eliminates y: 7x = 21, x = 3. Then y = (20 - 6)/3 = 14/3.

questions.question_text: The denominator of a fraction is 4 more than twice its numerator. When both numerator and denominator are decreased by 6, then the denominator becomes 12 times the numerator. Find the fraction.
questions.explanation_correct: Let numerator = x. Denominator = 2x + 4. (2x + 4 - 6) = 12(x - 6). 2x - 2 = 12x - 72, 70 = 10x, x = 7. Denominator = 18. Fraction = 7/18.
questions.explanation_incorrect: d = 2x + 4. After decrease by 6: d - 6 = 12(x - 6). Solving: x = 7, d = 18. Fraction = 7/18.

questions.question_text: For what value of k will the system of equations x + 2y = 5, 3x + ky + 15 = 0 have a unique solution?
questions.explanation_correct: Rewrite: x + 2y - 5 = 0, 3x + ky + 15 = 0. For unique solution: 1/3 != 2/k, k != 6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: For unique solution: a1/a2 != b1/b2, i.e., 1/3 != 2/k, so k != 6.

questions.question_text: Solve by substitution: 2x - y = 1, 3x + 2y = 19.
questions.explanation_correct: From 2x - y = 1: y = 2x - 1. Substituting into 3x + 2(2x - 1) = 19: 3x + 4x - 2 = 19, 7x = 21, x = 3. y = 5.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Express y = 2x - 1 from equation 1. Substitute into equation 2: 7x = 21, x = 3, y = 5.

questions.question_text: Solve: x + y = 7, 2x - 3y = -6.
questions.explanation_correct: Multiply first by 3: 3x + 3y = 21. Add to second: 5x = 15, x = 3. y = 4.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Multiply equation 1 by 3 and add to equation 2 to eliminate y: 5x = 15, x = 3, y = 4.

questions.question_text: If the sum of two numbers is 8 and difference is 2, the numbers are 5 and 3.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Solving x + y = 8 and x - y = 2 gives x = 5, y = 3. Both conditions are satisfied.

questions.question_text: Solve using cross-multiplication: 3x - 5y = 20, 6x - 10y = 40.
questions.explanation_correct: 3/6 = 5/10 = 20/40 = 1/2. All ratios are equal, so the lines are coincident. The system has infinitely many solutions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: a1/a2 = b1/b2 = c1/c2 = 1/2. The equations are dependent (represent the same line), giving infinitely many solutions.

questions.question_text: A lending library has a fixed charge for the first three days and an additional charge for each day thereafter. Saritha paid Rs 27 for a book kept for 7 days, while Susy paid Rs 21 for a book kept for 5 days. Find the fixed charge and per day charge.
questions.explanation_correct: Let fixed charge = f, per day charge = d. f + 4d = 27 (7-3=4 extra days), f + 2d = 21 (5-3=2 extra days). Subtracting: 2d = 6, d = 3. f = 21 - 6 = 15.
questions.explanation_incorrect: f + 4d = 27, f + 2d = 21. Subtract: 2d = 6, d = Rs 3. Then f = Rs 15.

questions.question_text: The pair of equations 5x - 15y = 8 and 3x - 9y = 24/5 represents:
questions.explanation_correct: 5/3 = 15/9 = 5/3. For c: 8/(24/5) = 8 x 5/24 = 40/24 = 5/3. All ratios equal 5/3. So the lines are coincident.
questions.explanation_incorrect: a1/a2 = 5/3, b1/b2 = 15/9 = 5/3, c1/c2 = 8/(24/5) = 5/3. All equal, so coincident lines.
